timeline.message: Extract server-timing trailer and create metrics for gfe latency

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Adds HeaderTracer and SpanName to CallOptions so we could surface metrics in the header
          
          
            
               * with {@link com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.stub.metrics.ClientHeaderInterceptor}.
          
          
            
               * */
          
          
            
               * Adds HeaderTracer and SpanName to CallOptions so we could surface metrics in the header with
          
          
            
               * {@link com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.stub.metrics.ClientHeaderInterceptor}.
          
          
            
               */
timeline.author: yoshi-code-bot
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -686,6 +710,28 @@ public EnhancedBigtableStub(EnhancedBigtableStubSettings settings, ClientContext
   }
   // </editor-fold>
 
+  /**
+   * Adds HeaderTracer and SpanName to CallOptions so we could surface metrics in the header
+   * with {@link com.google.cloud.bigtable.data.v2.stub.metrics.ClientHeaderInterceptor}.
+   * */

timeline.author: yoshi-code-bot
yoshi-code-bot

timeline.bodyText: I dont think this is needed for the emulator as it will only be sent by the GFE. So I think this should go in the newBuilder factory method. However that also creates frictions for users that would want to install their interceptor. Now they have to worry about chaining it with ours. So I think this should be injected at the end in finalizeSettings?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -127,6 +128,7 @@ public ManagedChannelBuilder apply(ManagedChannelBuilder input) {
                 .setKeepAliveTime(Duration.ofSeconds(30)) // sends ping in this interval
                 .setKeepAliveTimeout(
                     Duration.ofSeconds(10)) // wait this long before considering the connection dead
+                .setInterceptorProvider(BigtableInterceptorProvider.createDefault())

replies.bodyText: Removed the interceptor, using GrpcResponseMetadata instead.
replies.author: mutianf

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be better to name this FixedIterceptorProvider and put this in the gaxx package and then in the future to move it to gax proper. (This implies that the construction of the ClientHEaderInterceptor should move out of this class to the caller)
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be extracted into its own Callable that injects the CallOptions into the passed in ApiCallOptions
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: I would try to wrap both values in a single object to minimize the overhead of adding CallOptions entries which is backed by an array
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: I would add a comment that this shouldn't ever happen because the tracer is injected in ....
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: I'm also a little concerned about flooding the customer logs here. If the tracer is missing, it is quite likely that it will be missing for all of the requests. So this will log for every request
replies.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText:
I would keep this as a private method and instead expose concrete helpers that describe what you are recording: ie recordGfeLatency(String method, Duration duration)
recordMissingGfeHeader(String method)
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Should this be exposed to users? Unless there is a specific reason to access something, we should limit the exposed surface so that we can evolve our internal apis without worrying about breaking users
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText: Updated to InternalApi. This class still needs to be public so EnhancedStubSettings and EnhancedStub can use it.
replies.author: mutianf

timeline.bodyText: We should discuss if these should be part of the standard exposed metrics
timeline.author: igorbernstein2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,9 @@
           RpcViewConstants.BIGTABLE_COMPLETED_OP_VIEW,
           RpcViewConstants.BIGTABLE_READ_ROWS_FIRST_ROW_LATENCY_VIEW,
           RpcViewConstants.BIGTABLE_ATTEMPT_LATENCY_VIEW,
-          RpcViewConstants.BIGTABLE_ATTEMPTS_PER_OP_VIEW);
+          RpcViewConstants.BIGTABLE_ATTEMPTS_PER_OP_VIEW,
+          RpcViewConstants.BIGTABLE_GFE_LATENCY_VIEW,

replies.bodyText: Added a separate function for registering GFE views.
replies.author: mutianf

timeline.bodyText: We should avoid exposing this to customers. It's an implementation detail for the current approach. When this gets pushed into gax, we will move this into ApiTracer so we should minimize the amount public methods exposed (even if Beta). if this needs to be public then it should be INternalApi
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to record anything here?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

replies.bodyText:
This logic is moved to HeaderTracer.
I decided to keep this so if in any case gfe_latency is not recorded (for example, if the regex failed), we can check if gfe metrics were being tracked by check if gfe_header_missing_count recorded any values.
replies.author: mutianf

timeline.bodyText: Same flooding concern as above
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Also consider using auto-value
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.message: Refactor, use GrpcMetadataResponse to get the trailer
Fix based on the code review
Add more tests for all the ops

timeline.bodyText: Can you make this map instance shared with the attrs above?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

                         .build()),

                 settings.getTracerFactory())));

+            .setStatsAttributes(
+                ImmutableMap.<TagKey, TagValue>builder()

timeline.bodyText: do these have to be public?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: do we need the getters on the builder?
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Unless I;m mistaken, this shouldnt be necessary, autovalue should do null checks for all properties that arent marked Nullable
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment as to when spanName might be null. Its a bit surprising to me
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: I think these should be final
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Precondition checks would be good here
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText:
Please add a comment as to what this does. It will be helpful for future maintainers..Something like:
This callable will inject GrpcResponseMetadata into the ApiCallOptions. Upon rpc completion, gax will inject grpc trailers into this class. The trailers will then be processed by HeaderTracer
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

This class is considered an internal implementation detail and not meant to be used by + * applications. + */ +@InternalApi

replies.bodyText:
Also, can you add the new internal api classes to this exclusion list:
https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigtable/blob/master/pom.xml#L252

replies.bodyText: Good to know! In this case my classes were added under metrics so I think it's covered by: https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigtable/blob/master/pom.xml#L285

timeline.bodyText: similar to above

timeline.bodyText: This description is meant for end users who don't really know what t4t7 latency means. Can you reword this a bit?

timeline.bodyText: Please add a lot more docs explaining why you'd wanna do this. Also,@BetaApi

replies.bodyText: RpcViews class is already marked with @BetaApi so I'm skipping adding it here
replies.author: mutianf

timeline.bodyText: I think this needs to be atomic because this is set by a test thread and read by a server thread. Otherwise the cpu cache line might not be flushed
timeline.author: igorbernstein2

timeline.bodyText: Would you mind adding tests that ensure that the metric is incremented when server returns a non-ok status as well?
